raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "2.4mU IM / week for 3 weeks", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "For latent syphilis (both early and late latent) with normal CSF findings, the standard CDC-recommended treatment is benzathine penicillin G 2.4 million units IM weekly for 3 consecutive weeks (total 7.2 million units). The student's answer of 1.2mU is incorrect - this is half the required dose. Early latent syphilis requires only a single 2.4mU dose, but late/unknown duration latent syphilis requires the 3-week regimen at 2.4mU per week.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
